name: Apparitions and History of Our Lady of Czestochowa
summary: The icon of Our Lady of Czestochowa, also known as the Black Madonna, has been venerated in Poland since at least 1382 when it was brought to the Jasna GÃ³ra Monastery in Czestochowa. According to tradition, the icon was painted by St. Luke the Evangelist. The image has been credited with numerous miracles, including the defense of the monastery during sieges. Our Lady of Czestochowa is the patroness of Poland and one of the most important Marian images in Eastern Europe, attracting millions of pilgrims annually.
